result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy E Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Fine to be paid within 90 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Court waives DNA surcharge on count 3.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy E Anderson

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

3:30 PM Defendant Amy E Anderson in court.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Amy E Anderson. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State places offer on the record. 
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 & 3.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Counts 2 & 4 are Dismissed and read in.
State and defense make sentencing recommendations. 
Defendant makes statement to the court.

Court orders the following:
COUNT 1:

Fine:  $473.50
DNA Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges:  To be paid in 90 days. Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.

************************************************
COUNT 3: 
Fine:  316
DNA Surcharge:  Waived by the Court; 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges:  To be paid in 90 days. Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

to the Court requesting adjournment of 9/16 Pre-trial Conference filed by Atty. Zachary Hoff.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 08/29/22--Approved; to be scheduled for Plea/Sentencing for another date in September.**
Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:25 PM Defendant Amy E Anderson in court with attorney Kevin Gaertner for attorney Zachary Hoff.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gartner states they are waiting for discovery and request a new date for pretrial.  Court will adjourn to a new date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on July 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:24 PM Defendant Amy E Anderson in court with State Public Defender Law Intern.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
